availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Marmaduke Beckwith Morton, Sr. (Logan County, Kentucky, clerk and bank cashier.)

body.p: Logan County, Kentucky, clerk and bank cashier. Louisa County, Virginia, native. Son of William Jordan Morton and Martha Prior Morton. Married to Nancy Caldwell Morton in Logan County, Kentucky, in September 1827. Father of Daniel Morton, William Morton, and Daniel Morton. Married to Elizabeth Smith Morton Caldwell Morton in Logan County, Kentucky, in January 1838. Father of Nannie Morton. Clerk in Logan County in 1850. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in Logan County in 1850. Bank cashier in Logan County in 1860. Owned twenty enslaved persons in Logan County in 1860. Clerk of the Southern Bank of Kentucky in Logan County in 1861.
